column4: so my logitech IM Connect webcam works on 8.04 but not in jaunty. Any ideas?
I can't get it to work
I wish to use gtk-recordmydesktop
but it fails
what chipset is it ?
Oh shiii I forgot. What's the cammand for terminal again? lsusb?
not near enough awake to tell you ;)
look here http://stemp.wordpress.com/2008/09/15/intrepid-les-webcams-et-les-drivers-gspca/
shii umm drink 5 hour energy rofl
lsusb should tell you. I have a creative vistacam and before i had to use the hacked ov511 jpeg kernel module, but not works with gspca . . . .
but now works, i should say !!! ;)
I see. Well btw i am comming from Arch Linux since compiz is a pain there for nvidia cards...although I must admit if it were not for Arch I would not have learned things like lsusb
we all have command line goodness waiting to be discovered . . ..  :)
http://pastebin.com/m1223316
sorry, link was in french :).... you should have vendor ID and hardware ID : 0x046d  0x08d9
Do i really need that? Skype works in 9.04 which is what I have but gtk-mydesktop fails
so its not stricly a webcam issue, then.. it works, but not with mydesktop...
true
ok. no idea in that case, but good thing your cam works ;) is there a channel for gtk-mydesktop you can try in that case ?
sounds like a specific issue

let me make this more specific. When using skype, Audio is the only thing that works. Video crashes skype. In 8.04 things work just fine. Couldn't download 8.04 because everything mirror on the ubuntu website was 404.
every*
